SENT.plain: A patient presenting with a giant, fusiform middle cerebral artery aneurysm underwent extracranial to intracranial bypass grafting before permanent occlusion of the aneurysm
The patient was to return 4 months later for endovascular treatment
Arteriography obtained before obliteration revealed complete aneurysmal thrombosis
No further treatment was deemed necessary
Factors predisposing to thrombosis are discussed
